explanation: Vijayawada Central saw a 52% increase in revenue gap cases, driven by new Sale Deed registrations.
Anantapur Main experienced a sustained 38% rise in market value deviation over Q4, linked to agricultural land undervaluation.
Visakhapatnam Port recorded three times the normal exemption claim volume, with multiple invalid SC/ST and family transfer claims.
Rajahmundry Central had a cluster of 4 prohibited land registrations in the Godavari mangrove protection zone within a single month.
Guntur Main improved challan reconciliation turnaround by 25% over the quarter following process automation deployment.
Nellore City missed holiday surcharges on 80% more registrations during the Sankranti festival week compared to prior year.
Tirupati Urban showed a seasonal 65% uptick in high-risk cases during Q4, coinciding with temple town real estate demand surge.
Ongole Main had stamp duty short-collection amounts 2.1 times the state average, primarily due to incorrect rate slab application on lease deeds.
